events.1703: More than 8,000 people died in a cyclone in England.
events.1760: Mir Zafar was deposed and his son-in-law Mir Kasim became the Nawab of Bengal. He ruled till July 7, 1763.
events.1833: Raja Rammohan Roy, great social reformer, lawyer and politician passed away at Stapleton Grove in England.
events.1856: Pratap Narayan Mishra, Hindi writer, was born. He is one of the pioneers of mordern Hindi language.
events.1873: Vithalbhai Patel, great freedom fighter, social worker, nationalist leader, politician and President of the Central Assembly, was born at Karmasad, Gujarat.
events.1907: Bhagat Singh, the legendary revolutionary, was born at Banga in West Punjab, Layalpur now in Pakistan.
events.1908: Shiv Verma, great soldier, was born.
events.1958: Mihir Sen becomes the first Indian to cross the English Channel from Dover to Calais.
events.1972: Shri Shiyali Ramamrita Ranganathan, prolific author and first librarian of the University of Madras, passed away at the age of 80 at Bangalore.
events.1974: Pankaj Dharmani, Indian ODI batsman (1997), was born.
events.1977: Sanjiva Reddy was elected Speaker of the Lok Sabha. Government revokes the external emergency promulgated on December 3, 1971.
events.1989: Hemanta Kumar Mukherjee, noted playback singer and music director, died.
events.1990: Kabita Garari sets record for 10 Km W (Women) in 48.10 at Beijing Asian Games.
events.1993: Daily newspaper of Marathi Language "Samna" started its publication at Sambhaji Nagar (Aurangabad).
events.1995: 73 people died in a coal mine accident in Gaslitand in Dhanbad district, Bihar, when flood water leaked into the mine.
events.1999: Harshad Mehta and three others are convicted for misappropriating surplus funds of the Maruti Udyog Ltd.
events.2000: Venus Williams of USA claims the women's gold in the tennis event in the Sydney Olympics.
